trial_identification.studytitle: Randomized control study of post-operative pain in plasmaknife versus monopolar tonsillectomy
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Randomized control study of Plasmaknife Tonsillectomy versus Monopolar Electrocautery Tonsillectomy in effect on post-operative pain in adult patients

interventions.interventions: tonsillectomy performed with Plasmaknife is the study procedure, tonsillectomy performed with monopolar diathermy is the control procedure. It takes an average of 30 minutes to perform tonsillectomy.

primaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured on visual analogue scale daily on the first 14 days in the diaries kept by participants. The diaries are also used to record the nature and dose of analgesic used on each of the first 14 days

secondaryOutcome.timepoint: On each of the first 14 days

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Return to normal diet and usual activities following surgery
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Participant to be contacted after 4 weeks and queried
Participant to be queried on routine post-operative review after 2 weeks.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Having tonsillectomy for recurrent or chronic tonsillitis.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: History of malignancy or quinsy, bleeding or coagulation problems, significant medical problems, having implants precluding the use of monopolar diathermy, having inadequate use of English to fill in patient diary.

trial_design.concealment: patients satisfying the inclusion and exclusion criteria would be approached by the doctors at pre-admission clinic and given printed and verbal information. They would then be enrolled if they agree to participate. Treatment allocation occurs just prior to surgery with the allocated treatment plan contained in sealed envelopes.
